page.title: 11HONINGTON 40 YEARS AGO
page.content: The village of Honington had, until 1924, belonged to the family who lived at{Honington Hall.}After the village had been sold off in small lots, the Hall continued to provide employment for the village. The{population}of Honington is about 120,the same as 40 years ago. The village{houses}have changed considerably.Three small cottages,for example,were modernised and converted into one house.Other cottages were demolished and modern houses built in their place. In 1945,the{village school}had two teachers and about 20 children.In 1973 it closed and the children from the village now attend Shipston-on-Stour Junior and Infant School.The school building was sold and converted into a house.
